docs.lead_paragraph: The passivity of politicians has simply enabled mass shootings. It’s time for a new approach to gun violence.

headline.main: A New Way to Tackle Gun Deaths
headline.print_headline: A New Way to Tackle Gun Deaths

docs.abstract: Nicholas Kristof Op-Ed column advocates treating epidemic of gun deaths in United States as public heath problem, like smoking or car safety; notes gun deaths since 1970 have outnumbered deaths in all American wars combined; cites several popular proposals, some backed by gun owners, which experts claim could cut murder rate in half.
docs.snippet: The passivity of politicians has simply enabled mass shootings. It’s time for a new approach to gun violence.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: An anti-establishment mood in the Democratic Party is not only fueling the presidential campaign of Bernie Sanders, but also pushing liberals to mount more aggressive challenges to party-backed congressional candidates.

headline.main: Democrats Find That Anti-Establishment Isn’t Just a G.O.P. Theme
headline.print_headline: Insurgent Candidacies, Shaking Up G.O.P., Are Also Dogging Democrats

docs.abstract: Anti-establishment sentiments are harming presidential campaign of Hillary Rodham Clinton, and fueling rise of Sen Bernie Sanders; left's growing discontent with Democratic Party's progress on income equality and other progressive causes are also driving outsider candidates in Senate and House elections; some see analogy with Tea Party's effect on Republican Party.
docs.snippet: An anti-establishment mood in the Democratic Party is not only fueling the presidential campaign of Bernie Sanders, but also pushing liberals to mount more aggressive challenges to party-backed congressional candidates.

docs.lead_paragraph: A guide to deciding what kind of health insurance you might need, and advice on finding a plan that fits your budget and lifestyle.

headline.main: Finding a Health Insurance Plan That Travels With You
headline.print_headline: Health Insurance That Travels With You

docs.abstract: Stephanie Rosenbloom The Getaway column addresses whether to buy supplementary travel health insurance, particularly when traveling internationally; suggests travelers check with insurance providers to confirm coverage and offers checklist of suggested questions, from Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, to ask when contacting provider.
docs.snippet: A guide to deciding what kind of health insurance you might need, and advice on finding a plan that fits your budget and lifestyle.

docs.lead_paragraph: Baltimore's 23-20 victory over the Pittsburgh Steelers on Thursday took a heavy toll on the Ravens Saturday with Michael Campanaro being placed on injured reserve and fellow wide receiver Steve Smith listed as "week-to-week".

headline.main: Wide Receiver Smith 'Week-To-Week' for Injury-Hit Ravens
headline.print_headline: Wide Receiver Smith 'Week-To-Week' for Injury-Hit Ravens

docs.snippet: Baltimore's 23-20 victory over the Pittsburgh Steelers on Thursday took a heavy toll on the Ravens Saturday with Michael Campanaro being placed on injured reserve and fellow wide receiver Steve Smith listed as "week-to-week".

docs.lead_paragraph: A skunky aroma fills the room in which hundreds of lush marijuana plants grow, some nearly ready for harvest. Grower Ashley Thompson, a former high school agriculture teacher in this rural part of southeastern Illinois, takes the scent of weed home with her.

headline.main: Connecticut Agency to Play Key Role in Anthem/Cigna Merger
headline.print_headline: Connecticut Agency to Play Key Role in Anthem/Cigna Merger

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Friday said Arkansas must continue its Medicaid contract with Planned Parenthood while she considered a lawsuit challenging the state’s decision to end funding over secretly recorded videos by an anti-abortion group.

headline.main: Arkansas: Planned Parenthood Wins a Reprieve Over Medicaid Funding
headline.print_headline: Arkansas: Planned Parenthood Wins a Reprieve Over Medicaid Funding

docs.abstract: Federal Judge Kristine G Baker issues injunction stopping Arkansas from ending its Medicaid contract with Planned Parenthood while she considers lawsuit challenging state's decision to end funding based on videos that were secretly recorded by anti-abortion group.
docs.snippet: A federal judge on Friday said Arkansas must continue its Medicaid contract with Planned Parenthood while she considered a lawsuit challenging the state’s decision to end funding over secretly recorded videos by an anti-abortion group.

docs.lead_paragraph: While Republicans are busy railing against Obamacare, the top two Democrats offer radically different ideas on how to improve health care.
docs.abstract: Editorial assesses presidential candidates' plans for reforming nation's health care system; notes Democratic candidates Hillary Rodham Clinton and Sen Bernie Sanders have detailed plans that stake out drastically different positions; observes Republican candidates all wish to repeal Affordable Care Act, but have offered no alternative.
docs.snippet: While Republicans are busy railing against Obamacare, the top two Democrats offer radically different ideas on how to improve health care.

docs.lead_paragraph: Federal health officials on Friday expanded approval of an innovative Merck drug to treat patients with an advanced form of the most common lung cancer.

headline.print_headline: FDA Expands Merck Drug's Approval to Treat Lung Cancer
